How to change github remote url from http to ssh

##### ðŸ¤–ReplyðŸ¤–<!-- SOLVEIT_SEPARATOR_7f3a9b2c -->

To change your GitHub remote URL from HTTPS to SSH, youâ€™ll use the
`git remote set-url` command.

First, you can check your current remote URL:

``` python
!git remote -v
```

Then, to change it to SSH, youâ€™ll need to know your repositoryâ€™s SSH URL
(which looks like `git@github.com:username/repo.git`).

Would you like me to show you the command to change it, or do you
already know your SSH URL and want to try it yourself first?

Show me entire command

##### ðŸ¤–ReplyðŸ¤–<!-- SOLVEIT_SEPARATOR_7f3a9b2c -->

Hereâ€™s the command:

``` python
!git remote set-url origin git@github.com:username/repo.git
```

Replace `username` with your GitHub username and `repo` with your
repository name.

If your remote is named something other than `origin`, replace that too.
